[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@gnaudio/jabra-js](./jabra-js.md) &gt; [IConfig](./jabra-js.iconfig.md)

## IConfig interface

Optional configuration used when initializing the Jabra SDK.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare interface IConfig 
```

## Remarks

In particular, the `IJabraConfig` object allows you to overwrite the default message/warning/error logger with your own custom implementation.

## Properties

|  Property | Modifiers | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- | --- |
|  [appId?](./jabra-js.iconfig.appid.md) |  | string | <i>(Optional)</i> Unique string identifier for your application. You can choose whatever you like. The ID must be between 3 and 100 characters long. It can contain any combination of ASCII letters, numbers, dashes, and underscores. |
|  [appName?](./jabra-js.iconfig.appname.md) |  | string | <p><i>(Optional)</i> Provides a human-readable application name that shows when interacting with Jabra applications and services. For example, the Preferred Softphone selector in Jabra Direct.</p><p>The name must be no longer than 100 characters and can contain letters, numbers, ampersands, dashes, and spaces. It must begin with a letter or number.</p> |
|  [logger?](./jabra-js.iconfig.logger.md) |  | [ILogger](./jabra-js.ilogger.md) | <i>(Optional)</i> Implementation of the [ILogger](./jabra-js.ilogger.md) interface, used for logging runtime messages. Can be a custom implementation depending on the user's needs. |
|  [partnerKey?](./jabra-js.iconfig.partnerkey.md) |  | string | <i>(Optional)</i> This is used to uniquely identify a partner organization. Partner keys can be obtained from the [Jabra Developer Zone](https://developer.jabra.com)<!-- -->. |
|  [tracking?](./jabra-js.iconfig.tracking.md) |  | [TrackingOptions](./jabra-js.trackingoptions.md) | <p><i>(Optional)</i> The Jabra SDK can track usage and errors when allowed. See [TrackingOptions](./jabra-js.trackingoptions.md) for available settings.</p><p>Defaults to NO\_TRACKING.</p> |
|  [transport?](./jabra-js.iconfig.transport.md) |  | [RequestedBrowserTransport](./jabra-js.requestedbrowsertransport.md) | <p><i>(Optional)</i> If set, this enables the SDK user to explicitly choose which transport mechanism they would like to use.</p><p>The options are to use the Chrome extension (default behaviour), Chrome extension but falling back to WebHID if the extension is not available, or just WebHID.</p><p>Currently the WebHID-standard is only available in Chromium based browsers and requires active consent from the end-user.</p> |
